text: <@U01AVQSBTLJ> after doing a Racket version that takes 0.28 seconds, I coded up <https://github.com/lojic/LearningRacket/blob/master/advent-of-code-2020/day23-2.jl|this Julia version> which took 0.18 seconds, so I'm pretty pleased with Julia's speed here (although Racket wasn't terrible for what it is). (spoilers in thread)

which took 0.18 seconds, so I'm pretty pleased with Julia's speed here (although Racket wasn't terrible for what it is). (spoilers in thread)

text: For comparison, a different algorithm using a circular queue and a vector cross reference, was 2.2 seconds in Racket, so about 8x slower than the array technique shown in the Julia version.

elements.text: For comparison, a different algorithm using a circular queue and a vector cross reference, was 2.2 seconds in Racket, so about 8x slower than the array technique shown in the Julia version.

text: Without the cross reference, my queue version was going to take 11.8 hours :slightly_smiling_face:
